messages.subject: AHA!!! Another "fridgemonial"
messages.msgSnippet: ... spinning for 6 years and  stop and then try to walk you re going to keep spinning. In order to walk  straight you need a period of not spinning. So for now
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>>>learning is like walking and school is like spinning. If you've been
spinning for 6 years and stop and then try to walk you're going to keep
spinning. In order to walk straight you need a period of not spinning. So for now
declare life as a period of not spinning.<<<<<

I love this! I printed this and put it on our fridge!
Thanks again!
Angela

===============================

That's not from this list, but from unschooling.com
which I read right after writing the comment about refrigerator doors!

The quote is Joyce Fetteroll, responding to a mother whose son is wary of
unschooling and wants to keep being taught, but the mom would like to move
toward deschooling him.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
